intro: Alchemilla ischnocarpa, commonly known as the narrowleaf lady’s mantle, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of heart-shaped, silver-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Alchemilla ischnocarpa is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
